title: A Flood Of Gun Control Bills Could Wash Rights Away in Massachusetts
text:
Lawmakers in Massachusetts heard testimony on dozens of gun control bills this week, including testimony from the Gun Owner's Action League executive director Jim Wallace, who joins Cam to talk about the number of bills introduced that would make it even harder and more expensive to exercise a constitutional right.

Plus, one Missouri Congressman has a plan that would gut firearms preemption laws around the country, an Oklahoma lawmaker is hoping to repeal that state's constitutional carry law through a voter referendum, and a California man convicted in a brutal beating less than a year ago is already free, and is now charged with a murder that took place earlier this month.
